content.1: How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince’s daughter! the joints of thy thighs
content.6: How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!
content.7: This thy stature is like to a palm tree, and thy breasts to clusters
content.8: I said, I will go up to the palm tree, I will take hold of the boughs thereof: now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of the vine, and the smell of thy nose like apples;
content.9: And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine for my beloved, that goeth
content.11: Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages.
content.12: Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish,
content.13: The mandrakes give a smell, and at our gates
